feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 15 at 11:34AM AKDT until March 16 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 45 below zero to 55 below zero.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued March 14 at 2:13PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM AKDT TUESDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is in effect from 9 PM this evening to 11 AM AKDT Tuesday. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued March 15 at 10:58AM CDT until March 17 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...In Alabama, Baldwin Coastal and Mobile Coastal Counties. In Florida, Santa Rosa Coastal, Okaloosa Coastal and Escambia Coastal Counties.

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued March 15 at 10:56AM CDT until March 16 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 9 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Alabama, northwest Florida and southeast Mississippi. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 9 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Inland; Butler; Choctaw; Clarke; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia; Mobile Inland; Monroe; Washington; Wilcox

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued March 15 at 2:27PM PDT until March 16 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...North winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Mountains and Santa Barbara County South Coast. * WHEN...Until 3 AM PDT Wednesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Mountains; Santa Barbara County South Coast

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued March 15 at 2:27PM PDT until March 16 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...North winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Strongest in the mountains. * WHERE...Ventura County Mountains, Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range and Santa Clarita Valley.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range; Santa Clarita Valley; Ventura County Mountains

entry.title: Frost Advisory issued March 15 at 2:05PM PDT until March 16 at 10:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 10 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Temperatures as low as 33 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Coastal Del Norte, Northern Humboldt Coast, Southwestern Mendocino Interior and Southern Lake Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 10 AM PDT Wednesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal Del Norte; Northern Humboldt Coast; Southern Lake County; Southwestern Mendocino Interior

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued March 15 at 12:39PM PDT until March 17 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM WEDNESDAY TO 2 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...West facing beaches of Ventura County Coast. * WHEN...From 2 PM Wednesday to 2 PM PDT Thursday.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued March 15 at 12:39PM PDT until March 17 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 9 to 12 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...West and northwest facing beaches of San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara County Central Coast. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT Thursday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 15 at 6:11AM PDT until March 15 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Very long to long period west-northwest swell, sneaker waves and strong rip currents from coastal Sonoma County to coastal Monterey County through 7 PM PDT Tuesday... .Very long to long period west-northwest swell impacting the coast from Sonoma County to coastal Monterey County resulting in a high risk of sneaker waves and strong rip currents. Swell

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 15 at 3:04PM MDT until March 17 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO NOON MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Mosquito Mountain Range, East Lake County and the Eastern Sawatch Mountains Above 11000 Feet.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued March 15 at 10:45AM MDT until March 15 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY EXPECTED WITHIN THE TRI- STATE AREA THIS AFTERNOON... .Southerly winds gusting up to 30 mph are expected to develop in areas along the Colorado border in the Tri-State area this afternoon and persist into the early evening. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Coastal Wind Event Continues... An ongoing wake low event will keep winds gusting between 35 and 45 mph along coastal sections of Santa Rosa and Okaloosa counties in Florida through early this evening. entry.summary: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... .A surge of warm dry air will move north and east out of Colorado leading to gusty winds and low humidity across western and north central Nebraska.
